alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 21 at 11:01AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Comus affecting Humboldt County zone. .Warm temperatures may melt high mountain snowpack and increase stream flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Comus. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Minor lowland flooding throughout the reach. No flooding in Winnemucca. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM PDT Friday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Humboldt River Comus 9.5 7.7 Fri 10 am PD 8.8 9.5 9.6 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1200 PM PDT.
